meanings.sent1: After the war, many soldiers were widowing their wives.
meanings.sent2: She was widowing her friend by sharing stories of her late husband.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved widowing a volunteer from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The storm was widowing the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent5: The chef was widowing the pasta dough into individual portions.

meanings.definition: The state of being a widow.
meanings.sent1: Her widowing brought her closer to other women who had lost their spouses.
meanings.sent2: The widowing of her mother left her feeling alone in the world.
meanings.sent3: The widowing of the old house made it seem even more mysterious.
meanings.sent4: The widowing of the sky at dusk painted a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The widowing of the garden after winter made it ready for spring planting.
